column1: #Text=Pakistan court sentences one man to death penalty , and life imprisonment to five others for Mashal Khan lynching incident

#Text=On Wednesday , an anti-terrorism court in the Pakistani city of Haripur sentenced one man to death , and five others to life imprisonment , for killing 23-year-old Mashal Khan in a mob violence incident last year .
#Text=57 out of 61 verdicts were announced , which took place behind closed doors for security reasons , and about 250 police officials and commandos were deployed .
#Text=Imran Sultan Mohammad , who had confessed about shooting Mashal Khan , was sentenced to death by judge Fazal-e-Subhan .
#Text=Khan was a journalism student in Mardan 's Abdul Wali Khan University , who was accused of blasphemy , an offense punishable by death in Pakistan , and was killed in mob violence on April 13 .
#Text=Later in June , police investigation revealed it was a false accusation as they found no evidence of blasphemy .
#Text=Khan was stripped , beaten by dozens of people in the boys hostel , thrown from the second floor and shot dead — which was videographed and posted on social media .
#Text=Defense lawyer Saad Abbasi said 25 accused were sentenced to three-year prison , and 26 accused were released free from charges .
#Text=Mashal Khan 's brother Aimal Khan said , " Our demand was that all of the suspects should have been convicted [ ... ]

#Text=Pakistani Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif condemned the lynching last year and said ,  Let it be known to the perpetrators of this act that the state shall not tolerate citizens taking the law in their own hands .
